properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing baseball sized hail and damaging winds in excess of 110 km/h. At 7:54 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located just southeast of Eston and was moving toward the east at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2019-07-15T04:14:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T01:55:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0854218514.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T04:59:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:44:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2766954098.2019
Area: Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A stretch of hot and humid weather will begin on Monday and likely last into next weekend. Daytime high temperatures will be in the low to mid thirties with Humidex values at times approaching the low to mid forties. Overnight lows will remain in the low to mid twenties, offering little relief from the heat. Wednesday may be slightly cooler and not reach Heat Warning criteria, however the stretch of days before and after will attain Heat Warning criteria. A cooler air mass may arrive by next Sunday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T18:27:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T02:28:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4221295700.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid airmass will affect parts of Northwestern Ontario tonight into Monday. Daytime high temperatures will be near 29 degrees with humidex values near or above 36. Overnight low temperatures will remain near or above 18 degrees, which will not provide much relief from the heat. There is the potential that these hot conditions will continue on Tuesday. Cooler air is expected Tuesday night. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T18:17:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-15T02:18:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2197631116.2019
